intro: Gilia parryae, commonly known as Parry's gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments, such as deserts and mountain slopes. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Gilia parryae is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
